column4: hiyas, am back again after a short adventure with the router on 8.0.4...
thanks nixnoob and djhash for the advice.. not sirted yet, but feel it might be on the way..
pinging 192.168.1.1 gets nothing - and so is an attempt to point browser there
however, pinging 192.168.1.254 seems to work - but browsing there, get the browser to show the title of the router box on the window, nothing else
no - i didn't touch the settings at all
you trying to find the IP address of your router?
your IP can be anything but 192.168.1.254
that is, if you use a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0
- but 192.168.1.254 takes me to the router on xp
right, that has to be your default gateway then .. your IP address must be something different
so if i were you, i'd pick an IP address of 192.168.1.1, subnet mask 255.255.255.0 and default gateway 192.168.1.254
ok, run dhclient on that interface again .. then pastebin the output of this command.   ifconfig; route -n
you might need sudo where appropriate
ohh ok, you need to reboot into linux and try this then. , assuming eth0 is what you are configuring.  sudo dhclient eth0; ifconfig eth0; route -n
just did as you suggested.. how can i paste here large chunks of text without being punished..?
i don't see why you can't connect to the internet, everything here is perfect
what happens when you try and ping a host .. like google.com   ?
